meanings.definition: To fail to meet or encounter someone or something
meanings.sent1: I mismeet my friend at the park yesterday.
meanings.sent2: I always mismeet my deadlines at work.
meanings.sent3: The cat mismeet the mouse in a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The sun mismeeting the horizon painted the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The student's mismeet with the math problem left him puzzled.

meanings.definition: To meet or encounter someone or something in an inappropriate or unsuitable manner
meanings.sent1: She accidentally mismeet her boss at the grocery store.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to mismeet cultural traditions when traveling.
meanings.sent3: The clown mismeet the serious situation with a joke.
meanings.sent4: His words mismeet the gravity of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The actor's mismeet with the audience led to an awkward silence.
